name: Moroccan Chicken Thighs
author: Scott Heddle
summary: Quick and easy thighs with complex Moroccan flavors. Serve with rice, garnished with lemon wedges.
ingredients: kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon canola oil, or to taste
directions: Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper
Let come to room temperature, about 30 minutes
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Combine chicken broth, paprika, cumin, ginger, turmeric, cinnamon, and 2 teaspoons lemon zest in a bowl
Heat oils in a cast iron skillet until they begin to smoke
Add chicken thighs, skin-side down, and cook for 4 minutes
Flip thighs and continue cooking until skin is crispy, about 4 minutes more
Saute onion in the skillet until softened, 3 to 5 minutes
Pour chicken broth mixture carefully over onion; scrape up any browned bits off the bottom of the skillet
Return chicken thighs to the skillet
Spoon some of the liquid over the thighs
Transfer skillet to the preheated oven; bake until chicken thighs are no longer pink in the center, 25 to 30 minutes
Drizzle lemon juice over the thighs and garnish the whole dish with parsley
